      <div class="row lowerPanel">
       <div class="span7 cms-editable" id="introRow">
        <h3>
         Welcome to Lutheran Services Carolinas!
        </h3>
        <!-- <div class="span3 donate" style="float: right;">
                             <img src="assets/img/hdr-donate-now.jpg" alt="Donate Now!">
                             <p><a href="how-you-can-help/donate-now/">Donate Now</a></p>
                         </div> -->
        <p>
         <a href="how-you-can-help/donate-now/">
          <img alt="Donate Now" class="imgFloatRight" id="e716b1" src="assets/img/donate-now-photo.jpg"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <!--
 <p>With the help of thousands of volunteers, donors, and advocates, LSC helps veterans and others transition from homelessness to dignity; protects children at risk of abuse and neglect with foster care; improves the lives of those battling severe and persistent mental illness through innovative programs; encourages growth and independence for those with developmental disabilities; places children in loving adoptive homes; provides warmth and welcome to refugees seeking sanctuary; and enables many men and women with varying life challenges or disabilities to live proudly and independently with residential or supportive services.</p>
 <p>LSC also provides comprehensive residential options and support services to North Carolina seniors including vibrant retirement communities, quality rehabilitation and skilled care nursing services, assisted living residences, at-home care, adult day services, geriatric care management, and caregiver support.</p>
 -->
        <p>
         With the help of thousands of volunteers, donors, and advocates, LSC reaches out to veterans facing homelessness; safeguards survivors of human trafficking; protects children through foster care; 
 advocates for those battling severe and persistent mental illness; fosters independence in those with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities; helps children find loving adoptive homes; 
 welcomes refugees seeking sanctuary; assists those affected by disasters; and improves the lives of many other vulnerable populations facing extraordinary life challenges.
        </p>
        <p>
         LSC also offers a wide range of residential options and services to North Carolina seniors including vibrant retirement communities; quality rehabilitation and skilled care nursing services; 
 assisted living residences; at-home care and nursing services; adult day services; and caregiver support.
        </p>
        <p>
         <img alt="Connet-4-Good" class="imgFloatLeft" src="assets/img/C4G-small.jpg"/>
        </p>
        <p>
         <br/>
         <br/>
         If you would like to join LSC's growing network of supporters, call 1-800-HELPING and learn more about Connect-4-Good. Connect-4-Good is an ongoing awareness effort encouraging philanthropy, 
 advocacy, and volunteerism for the benefit of those served by LSC.
        </p>
       </div>

             <td>
              <h4>
               <a class="newsTitle blue" href="/who-we-are/news/trinity-grove-veteran-shares-memories-of-surviving-pearl-harbor-attack">

             <td>

    <div class="container quotes">
     <div class="row">
      <div class="span12">
       <h3>
        Kudos
       </h3>
       <div class="carousel slide" id="quoteCarousel">
        <!-- <ol class="carousel-indicators">
                         <li data-target="#quoteCarousel" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
                         <li data-target="#quoteCarousel" data-slide-to="1"></li>
                         <li data-target="#quoteCarousel" data-slide-to="2"></li>
                       </ol> -->
        <!-- Carousel items -->
        <!-- Carousel nav -->
        <!-- Wrapper for slides -->
        <div class="carousel-inner">
         <div class="active item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            LSC follows the mandate of Jesus to serve all of those people who are unable to care for themselves.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Former LSC Board Chair Jerry Bramley
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            I have been so blessed to have compassionate and caring people to surround me during my stay here at Trinity Place. Your words of encouragement have been so meaningful....It has been uplifting to renew knowledge of many of my former students employed here. Indeed, I am proud that they are such good workers....Count on me to share the good news of your "healing rehab program" (that has) a tremendous group of therapists.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Carolyn Miller Thompson
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Thank you so much for all you did for our mom during her three years at Trinity Oaks. We are totally convinced moving there prolonged her life and she was much safer. Mom and all of us so enjoyed Wine Down and the Christmas parties and the great staff that cared so much. We will never forget your kindness.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            The family of Margie Payne
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            The love, attention, and care that my mom received from the employees of Trinity Elms validated my having made the right decision for my mom. The employees of Trinity Elms did the heavy lifting for my mom in the final months of her life. My mom on many occasions told me how well she was being cared for. To all of you who had contact with my mother (Mercedes McCarroll), thank you for all you did for us.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Stephen McCarroll
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            (Dad) said they (Trinity Oaks staff) made him feel like a king!
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            The family of Jay Mee, resident of Trinity Oaks
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Words could never express our thanks for all you did for our mother. From the day I walked in (to Trinity Glen) almost four years ago, your care and compassion was constant and genuine....little things like fixing her hair, rubbing her legs, hugging her, singing to her, wiping her tears, giving her some chocolate ice cream! I will never forget your thoughtfulness.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Jan Wallin and family
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            I have been in nursing for over 30 years. I am quick to comment or question issues that I see as a problem, especially if it involves my mother. We have had absolutely no problems with mom's care. What a blessing your facility has been for us. We are unable to care for mom at home, so it fills our hearts to know we can trust someone with her care that truly cares about her.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Paulette Sigmon, mother of Joan Campbell, Trinity Village resident
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "....I want to thank...everyone at Trinity Elms for your support of my mother (and me) over the last two months. Everyone says my mom looks great and I'm sure the care she received at Trinity Elms is a big part of the reason."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Katherine Voss, daughter of Trinity Elms rehab patient Ruth Voss
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Thank you to each of you for your care for my mom, Sara Bruce. You kept her comfortable, loved her, prayed with her, encouraged her, laughed with her -- thank you for laughing with Sara! .....Each of you are amazing. I love each of you, and thank you.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Mindy, daughter of Sara Bruce
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Thank you for your fine care of our Dad. We feel blessed that you loved him as did we. Blessings on you as you continue your mission of caring for our elders."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            The Hart children to the staff of Trinity Oaks
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "A late compliment and ‘thank you’ for a dinner that topped all dinners I have been to in Chicago, New York and around the world I traveled. The kitchen is always good but I wore out the menu showing it to friends."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Ruth Gordon to the staff of Trinity View
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "I would like to express my appreciation for the excellent care and therapy while there. It was my second time there and everyone was so kind and courteous. May God bless each of you and your residents &amp; your families."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Melba Sidden to the staff of Trinity Glen
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "We just wanted to take a moment to let you know just how much our family appreciates the excellent care given to our mom during her stay at Trinity Elms...All of you, PT department, CNA's, RN's, kitchen staff and administrative staff have been so supportive....All of you demonstrated such care and love to all of us. "
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            The children of Vae Lambeth to the staff of Trinity Elms health &amp; rehab
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Thank you so much for hosting me…and for sharing the good work of all of you in refugee resettlement services. All of the stories, including yours, are enlightening."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Beth Webb to the staff of SC Refugee Resettlement
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            ...you provided me with the very best treatment...but probably the best thing was the friendship you gave me; that friendship was the best healing I could have gotten anywhere.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Bob Davis, rehab patient at Trinity Elms
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            The therapy program [at Trinity Place] is outstanding! All my therapists were wonderful and had me work hard and explained everything to me. Barbara Blalock was awesome! Patient, kind, stern, encouraging and loving. Her therapy enabled me to get to assisted living...I just can't say enough about all my therapists. The nurses (Terry, Kim and Audry) were always quick to answer, explain and inform both me and my family. Admissions was a breeze with the excellent staff.
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Dennie Carpenter, Trinity Place rehab patient
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "They treated my mom as if she were their own, always having her best interest at heart. We are appreciative of their kindness and compassion. We are truly grateful for Trinity Elms..."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Andrea Stanfield Nifong daughter of Trinity Elms residents Bill and Babs Stanfield
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Just wanted to let you know that the Lutheran home in Hickory, Trinity Ridge, is the best! I recently had my cousin (90) there for therapy, and the staff, room, and FOOD (so important for her happiness!) were outstanding. I had her moved from a 'good' place in Charlotte to Trinity Ridge, and the difference was night and day. What a tremendous service. "
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            Eliza Bishop
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
         <div class="item">
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Thank you for the love, care, and concern you had for Dad. You were all so special to him. The love of God shown through you all."
           </p>
           <cite class="blue">
            The family of Jack Caneclides to the staff of Trinity Place
           </cite>
          </blockquote>
         </div>
        </div>

        </a>

       </div>
